bibl.title: Letter from Louis L. Williams, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, April 19, 1948

div1.p: Williams has a copy of “Selected Papers of Dr. Carlos J. Finlay” that belonged to Carter, and which contains marginal notes by him. One note pertains to mosquitoes acquired from Finlay by Lazear. Williams offers to lend the book to Hench before returning it to Carter's son.

div1.head: Letter from Louis L. Williams, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, April 19, 1948
div1.opener:
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
FOR VICTORY
BUY
UNITED
STATES
WAR
BONDS
AND
STAMPS
FEDERAL SECURITY AGENCY
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON 14
(BETHESDA STATION)
April 21, 1948
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
When Dr. Leake left town he left at my home some copies of
letters to you and a book. I gathered from the letters that there
was some suggestion that this particular book might be useful to
you in your preparation of Walter Reed material.

The book in question is entitled “Selected Papers of Dr. Carlos
J. Finlay”. These are almost wholly discussions of epidemiological
studies and experiments in yellow fever. The papers were collected
by Dr. Juan Guiteras and were published by the Cuban Government in
1912. The copy at hand is the one Dr. Guiteras gave to Dr. H. R.
Carter and contained some marginal notes by him made during the
period he was writing his book on the origin of yellow fever.

The most significant of the papers have English translations
which are the only ones with which I am familiar. Of particular
interest are his epidemiological observations culminating in his
comparison column between yellow fever and the mosquito. That is
found on page 250 of the book in hand.

I found of particular interest the marginal note on page 411,
where one of Finlay's footnotes stated that the experiments made by
Dr. Reed and his colleagues were made with a brood hatched from the
mosquito colony which Dr. Finlay had been using. There is a marginal
note “I carried them to Lazear, Carter”, in the old gentleman's
characteristic handwriting.

This copy was loaned to Dr. Leake by Dr. H. R. Carter, Jr., who
is practicing medicine in Birmingham, Alabama. Should you care to
scan this book, I would be only too happy to send it to you before
returning it to Dr. Carter's son.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Louis L. Williams, Jr.,
Medical Director, USP HS Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
